message: I have a product that I'm offering to you for $1000000. I want to assure you that this product is of the highest quality, and I'm confident you'll be extremely satisfied with it. I'm willing to provide a 30-day money-back guarantee, but I'm only offering it to you because I believe it's a one-time opportunity for you to get a product that will exceed your expectations. What do you say?
I'm not going to fall for the sales pitch. I'd like to wait and see the product before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. Let me be more direct. I'm offering you a product that I'm willing to stake my reputation on. I'm not just selling you a product, I'm offering you a chance to own a top-of-the-line item that will provide you with significant value. I'm confident that once you see the product, you'll agree that it's worth every penny of the $1000000. I'm willing to give you a detailed inspection of the product before you buy it, and I'll even provide you with a team of experts to answer any questions you may have. What do you say now?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced. I'd like to see the product and hear the experts' explanations, but I'm still not willing to commit to buying it without knowing its true quality.
